meanings.definition: Serving to educate again or differently.
meanings.sent1: The reeducative program helped students understand math concepts better.
meanings.sent2: The workshop offered reeducative materials to enhance employees' skills.
meanings.sent3: The reeducative video on history made learning fun and engaging.
meanings.sent4: Her reeducative approach to problem-solving opened up new perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The reeducative seminar left a lasting impact on the participants.

meanings.sent1: The reeducative book introduced advanced concepts to the readers.
meanings.sent2: The training session was reeducative, teaching the team innovative techniques.
meanings.sent3: The reeducative workshop on gardening was both informative and enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: Her reeducative methods transformed the way students approached challenges.
meanings.sent5: The reeducative course broadened their understanding of the subject.

meanings.definition: Involving the process of learning or teaching again.
meanings.sent1: The reeducative process helped the students grasp complex topics.
meanings.sent2: The reeducative session focused on revisiting key concepts.
meanings.sent3: The reeducative quiz was a fun way to review the material.
meanings.sent4: Her reeducative style of teaching motivated students to excel.
meanings.sent5: The reeducative activity encouraged active participation in class.
